programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.

programme.title: Save the Cinema
programme.desc: Drama telling the true story of Liz Evans from Carmarthen, south-west Wales, who started a campaign in the 1990s to save the town's Lyric Cinema. With the help of local politician Richard Goodridge, Liz manages to persuade Steven Spielberg to show a premiere of Jurassic Park at the Lyric. Starring Samantha Morton, Tom Felton and Jonathan Pryce.

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.

programme.title: I Used to Be Funny
programme.desc: A stand-up comedian struggling with PTSD agonises over whether or not to join the search for a missing teenage girl she used to look after. Writer-director Ally Pankiw's comedy drama, starring Rachel Sennott and Olga Petsa.

programme.title: L'immensità
programme.desc: In 1970s Rome, a mother contends with her loveless and abusive marriage while caring for her children, one of who is experiencing gender dysphoria and wishes to identify as a boy. Family drama, starring Penélope Cruz, Vincenzo Amato and Luana Giuliani. In Italian.

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: Wallace is a medical school drop-out who has given up on love after a series of bad break-ups, while Chantry is an animator who lives with her boyfriend. The two become friends since neither is interested in a relationship with the other - but as they grow closer, they begin to wonder if they belong together. Romantic drama, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Zoe Kazan.

programme.title: Miranda's Victim
programme.desc: Teenager Patricia 'Trish' Weir is committed to putting her kidnapper and rapist Ernesto Miranda in prison, while her life is wrecked by the legal system. Drama, starring Abigail Breslin, Emily VanCamp and Kyle MacLachlan.

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: West North West
programme.desc: A romance develops between a Japanese bartender, an Iranian art student and a Japanese model. Drama, starring Hanae Kan and Sahel Rosa.(n)

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.(n)

programme.title: Save the Cinema
programme.desc: Drama telling the true story of Liz Evans from Carmarthen, south-west Wales, who started a campaign in the 1990s to save the town's Lyric Cinema. With the help of local politician Richard Goodridge, Liz manages to persuade Steven Spielberg to show a premiere of Jurassic Park at the Lyric. Starring Samantha Morton, Tom Felton and Jonathan Pryce.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Bonus Track
programme.desc: An aspiring teenage musician teams up with the son of a rock star to try and win the school talent show. Comedy, starring Joe Anders, Samuel Small and Susan Wokoma.(n)

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: American fashion model-turned-war photographer Lee Miller is determined to document the truth of the Nazi regime, and in spite of the odds stacked against female correspondents, she captures some of the most important images of the Second World War. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Winslet, Andy Samberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Marion Cotillard.(n)

programme.title: Miranda's Victim
programme.desc: Teenager Patricia 'Trish' Weir is committed to putting her kidnapper and rapist Ernesto Miranda in prison, while her life is wrecked by the legal system. Drama, starring Abigail Breslin, Emily VanCamp and Kyle MacLachlan.(n)

programme.title: West North West
programme.desc: A romance develops between a Japanese bartender, an Iranian art student and a Japanese model. Drama, starring Hanae Kan and Sahel Rosa.(n)

programme.title: Quadrophenia
programme.desc: A teenager in 1960s London is unhappy with his lot in life, but believes he has found a place to belong in the mod subculture and their feud with the rival rockers. But bit by bit, his naive vision of the world is cruelly shattered. Drama based on the Who album, starring Phil Daniels, Leslie Ash, Sting and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
programme.desc: An aspiring writer falls for a seemingly happy-go-lucky woman living in the same apartment building, and is drawn to her unconventional lifestyle. However, he detects her quirky demeanour is masking a colourful past, while her mysterious visits to an imprisoned gangster have unexpected consequences. Romantic comedy drama based on Truman Capote's novel, with Audrey Hepburn, George Peppard, Mickey Rooney and Martin Balsam.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Bookworm
programme.desc: Mildred, an 11-year-old girl, finds her world turned upside down when her estranged father, a washed-up magician, takes her on a wild adventure. Family comedy, starring Elijah Wood and Nell Fisher.(n)

programme.title: Rebellious
programme.desc: A princess is kidnapped by an evil sorcerer and her scholarly fiance must use his wits in an epic quest to find her, while she boldly challenges her captors and plots a daring escape. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Vanessa Johansson and Marc Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: A family tragedy woos Delia Deetz, daughter Lydia and rebellious teenage granddaughter Astrid back to the close-knit community of Winter River. Astrid accidentally opens a portal to the afterlife by summoning Beetlejuice three times. The mischievous demon ricochets between realms, wreaking havoc wherever he goes. Tim Burton's comedy sequel, starring Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder and Jenna Ortega.(n)

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: Futuristic action adventure starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron. In a world where water is precious and humanity faces extinction, a one-armed woman takes off across the desert with a lorry-load of females who've been imprisoned to bear children. Riding shotgun is Max, the infamous "Road Warrior".

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Paul Walker and Vin Diesel. When illegal street racer Dominic Toretto is suspected of being the mastermind behind a series of truck hijacks, undercover police officer Brian O'Conner is sent to infiltrate his gang. But O'Conner's judgement becomes clouded when he falls in love with Toretto's sister, Mia.

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Adam Sandler, Kate Beckinsale and Christopher Walken. Architect Michael Newman's will to succeed at work has come at the expense of quality time with his beautiful wife and children. But then Michael comes into possession of a remote control that allows him to pause, rewind and fast-forward his life just as he pleases.

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Adam Driver and PenÃ©lope Cruz. Enzo Ferrari and his wife Laura have equal shares in their car-manufacturing company, but their marriage is in tatters following the death of their son, while the business is in financial peril. With the 1957 Mille Miglia endurance race looming, Enzo seeks victory for Ferrari, whatever the cost.

programme.title: Arthur's Whisky
programme.desc: When Joan's husband dies, she discovers he'd invented an anti-aging elixir that literally takes the years off. Sharing it with her friends Linda and Susan, the rejuvenated women waste little time in painting the town red, but they soon realise it's a very different world to the one they remember. Co-writer/director Stephen Cookson's comedy, starring Diane Keaton, Hayley Mills, Patricia Hodge, Lulu

programme.title: Night Swim
programme.desc: Forced into early retirement by a degenerative illness, former baseball player Ray Waller moves into a new house with his wife and two children. He hopes that the backyard swimming pool will be fun for the kids and provide physical therapy for himself. However, a dark secret from the home's past soon unleashes a malevolent force that drags the family into the depths of inescapable terror. Writer/d

programme.title: Despicable Me
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring the voice of Steve Carell. Behind the seemingly tranquil faÃ§ade of small-town America, super-criminal Gru plots his biggest heist yet: to steal the Moon. But an encounter with orphan sisters Margo, Edith and Agnes proves that even the most dastardly villain has a soft centre.

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: Comedy starring Rowan Atkinson as the accident-prone Mr Bean. In an attempt to get rid of him from his job as one of their attendants, the governors of the National Gallery send Mr Bean to America to represent them at the unveiling of the Grierson Gallery's new purchase. Needless to say disaster is never far away.

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: Musical comedy prequel to Roald Dahl's Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, starring TimothÃ©e Chalamet. Young Willy Wonka yearns to produce his own confectionary, but finds trouble in the form of a shady cartel of chocolatiers and a mysterious thief.

programme.title: Aquaman
programme.desc: Action fantasy starring Jason Momoa, Amber Heard and Nicole Kidman. Arthur Curry (aka Aquaman), the half-human heir to the throne of Atlantis, has long since rejected his underwater brethren. But when his half-brother and current king Orm plots to destroy the surface world, Arthur is drawn into a quest to unite the marine realms and save humanity.

programme.desc: Five women participate in a hiking retreat, but only four come out the other side. Federal agents Aaron Falk and Carmen Cooper head into the mountains hoping to find their informant still alive. Thriller, starring Eric Bana, Anna Torv and Deborra-Lee Furness.

programme.desc: Aboard the International Space Station, tensions flare between the US and Russian astronauts after a nuclear war breaks out on Earth. Sci-fi space thriller, starring Ariana DeBose, Chris Messina and John Gallagher Jr.

programme.desc: Action comedy starring Josh Hartnett and Charithra Chandran. programme.desc: Brenda visits Billy in the institution; David must take a stand at church; Gabe behaves badly at a party with Claire.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: Marshall
programme.desc: Young Thurgood Marshall faces one of his greatest challenges while working as a lawyer for the NAACP. He teams up with lawyer Sam Friedman to defend Joseph Spell, a Black chauffeur whose employer accuses him of sexual assault and attempted murder.

programme.title: Knox Goes Away
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a rapidly evolving form of dementia, a contract killer gets the chance to redeem himself by saving the life of his estranged son.

programme.title: Look Into My Eyes
programme.desc: A group of New York City psychics conducts deeply intimate readings for their clients, revealing a kaleidoscope of loneliness, connection and healing.

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
programme.desc: In the 28th century, two special operatives (Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne) race against time to save the diverse city of Alpha from a dark force that also jeopardizes the future of the universe.

programme.title: Queer
programme.desc: Lee, a solitary American in Mexico City, falls for a beautiful, elusive former soldier. Journeying together into the jungle, Lee sees, for the first time, the possibility of an intimate and infinite love.

programme.title: Heretic
programme.desc: A diabolical Mr. Reed ensnares two young missionaries in a terrifying game of cat and mouse when they knock on the wrong door and are forced to prove their faith.

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: Two LAPD officers deal with marriage, love and fatherhood amid the harsh realities on the streets of Los Angeles.

programme.title: This Means War
programme.desc: Once inseparable pals and partners, two CIA agents (Chris Pine, Tom Hardy) turn their deadly skills and an array of high-tech gadgetry against each other after both fall for the same woman (Reese Witherspoon).

programme.title: Wild Wild Space
programme.desc: It chronicles the modern day, celestial land grab happening above our heads. It's a fast paced, high stakes race of epic proportions in which companies compete to blast satellite carrying rockets into low earth orbit.

programme.title: Janet Planet
programme.desc: Enthralled by her own imagination, 11-year-old Lacy spends the long summer at home with her mother and three strangers.

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: A genetically engineered soldier (Channing Tatum) informs an ordinary woman (Mila Kunis) of her destiny as the next recipient of an extraordinary inheritance that could alter the balance of the cosmos.

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga: Chapter 1
programme.desc: In 1859 families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas. Meanwhile, a gruff cowboy soon finds himself on the run with a prostitute and a young boy after killing a fellow gunman.

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: Members (Emjay Anthony, Adam Scott, Toni Collette) of a dysfunctional family face the wrath of Krampus, an ancient demon from European folklore who punishes naughty children at Christmastime.

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: The CIA's most dangerous former operative is drawn out of hiding to uncover more explosive truths about his past.

programme.title: Dune: Part Two
programme.desc: Paul Atreides unites with Chani and the Fremen while seeking revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family. Facing a choice between the love of his life and the fate of the universe, he must prevent a terrible future only he can foresee.

programme.title: Companion
programme.desc: A weekend getaway at a remote cabin turns to chaos when it's revealed that one of the guests -- a subservient android built for human companionship -- has gone haywire.

programme.title: Black Death
programme.desc: A monk investigates rumors of people being resurrected during an outbreak of the bubonic plague.

programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Edward undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance. But his new dream face turns into a nightmare as he becomes obsessed with reclaiming what he lost.

programme.title: The Front Room
programme.desc: Everything goes to hell for newly pregnant Belinda after her mother-in-law moves in. As the diabolical guest tries to get her claws on the child, Belinda must draw the line somewhere.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: Young Andy receives a special present from his mom -- a seemingly innocent Buddi doll that becomes his best friend. When the doll suddenly takes on a life of its own, Andy unites with other kids to stop the sinister toy from wreaking bloody havoc.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: A struggling single mother unknowingly gifts her son a doll imbued with a serial killer's consciousness.

programme.title: Another Earth
programme.desc: Following her release from prison, a morose young woman (Brit Marling) seeks out the man (William Mapother) whose life she shattered in a car accident several years earlier.

programme.title: Quad Gods
programme.desc: Following the lives of three New Yorkers with quadriplegia that meet in a neuro rehabilitation lab where they create the world`s first ever, fully quadriplegic e-sports team.

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: An art forger (John Travolta) arranges an early release from prison so that he can spend time with his dying son, then must pull off one final job for the man who made his freedom possible.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple (Zach Galifianakis, Isla Fisher) discover it's not easy keeping up with their gorgeous and ultra-sophisticated new neighbors, the Joneses, especially when they discover that Mr. and Mrs. Jones are really covert operatives.

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: Armed with proton packs, four paranormal investigators (Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis) battle mischievous ghouls in New York.

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: Now the parapsychologists (Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd) are trying to rid New York of stress-related pink slime.
